intro: Iguanura myochodoides, commonly known as the yellow-eyed pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with red stamens. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its fruits are fleshy berries that contain numerous small seeds. Iguanura myochodoides is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray.
